descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement from Srivis-Amla Hair oil, we see the Hindu gos Lorn Vishnu depicted with the king of all nagas, the five headed snake Anantha-Shesha. Next to Vishnu, there are two Hindu women depicted sitting also on Ananta-Shesha's body. The image is framed by some flowers. The lower section hosts a detailed of the products being offered by the company advertising as well as contact details.

inscription.text: 'Srivis-Amla' Hair Oil (Registered) Prepared with herbs, cools and refreshes

Srivis Amla Hair Oil Cools the brain, removes headache, burning sensation of the eyes, giddiness of the brain, helps the growth of hair, removes dandruff, & gives a glossy appearance, making the hair get black.
Srivis perfumery works Proprietors: S. Viswanadham & Co. 44, Bunder st. Madras

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Poster advertisement of Srivis-Amla Hair Oil

description-en: On this advertisement from Srivis-Amla Hair oil, we see the Hindu gos Lorn Vishnu depicted with the king of all nagas, the five headed snake Anantha-Shesha. Next to Vishnu, there are two Hindu women depicted sitting also on Ananta-Shesha's body. The image is framed by some flowers. The lower section hosts a detailed description of the products being offered by the company advertising as well as contact details. (gs)
